intro: Acrocomia tenuifrons, commonly known as the narrow-leaved palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its slender, clustered stems and long, narrow leaves that give it its common name. Its inflorescences produce small, yellowish flowers that are followed by triangular, spiky fruits. Acrocomia tenuifrons is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional practices in its native regions.
